data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The instructions to take 9 steps left must always be facing forward. When you take 9 steps left, you are returning to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turning around means changing position, taking 4 steps, and return to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you follow 7 steps, you will return to the starting point after 6 steps. Or 10 steps after 4 steps, you will return to the starting point after 4 steps. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You can always go back to the starting point when you get back to your original path. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turning left is a turn that goes left 1st and you do this on your way back. Turning left 3 times is a turn that goes left 1st and you do this on your way back. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn left. Turn right. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 7 steps. Turn right. Turn left. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn around and then turn around back to the beginning. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn right. Turn right. Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Your next step should take you home. Your home step should be the same as your first one. So, the answer is Yes.

You return to the starting point by turning around and taking 8 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The first step takes 4 steps forward and the third step takes 6 steps forward. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 2 steps. Take 7 steps. Take 3 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You cannot take 2 steps back to the starting place if we already took 9 steps. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 3 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Backward takes you backward. Forward takes your steps forward. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 5 steps left. Take 2 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Backwards is the opposite of forward. Forward is opposite of left. Taking 1 step backward is the same as taking a step backward. One can only take one step backward twice. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps left. Take 3 steps left. Take 1 step left. Take 3 steps backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 4 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you' reversing the direction in which you started, you'reversing backward. If you return to the direction you started, you' reversing forward. So, the answer is Yes.

In the first step the direction is facing forward. You are oriented facing forward so the previous direction is facing you. The last step is also facing forward so the previous direction is now facing you. So, the answer is no.

If one turns 90 degrees, one always faces forward. If one is on the left, he takes 6 steps left. So, one can also face forward. So, the answer is No.

The first direction is going around, the next is going left. It's the same steps as the previous direction except you're going in the same direction. You are now going to take the same direction as the previous direction, so the next direction you take is left. So, the answer is Yes.

If you take all 7 steps left and the next 7 steps right, that must be 2 steps right. If you make 1 step backward, that must be 5 steps backward. If you take 8 steps, that must be 7 steps left and the next 8 steps right. If you make 1 step forward, that must be 7 steps left and the next 8 steps right. It is also stated one step right after both steps to return back to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

Thus, always take four steps right. So, always face forward. Thus, always face forward. So, always face forward. So, always face forward. Thus, always face forward. So, always take five steps right. You must face left. One step in one direction is required to repeat the previous step. Assuming you’ re facing forward after taking 6 steps east you would need to take 8 steps left. Being in two circles could leave you with 1 or more remaining steps. You must take two steps out to the left. If you’ re facing the other direction backward you would take one step backward first and once you’ ve taken two steps out you would take two steps backward next. In addition, you can’ t return to the starting point after taking 5 steps left. So, the answer is No.
